intro: Reseda paui, commonly known as the Brazilian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and the plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils. Reseda paui is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
